channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flyposting on Phone Box, 21st June
item.description:
Phone box located outside - 229 Great Portland St, London W1W 5PN The phone box is entirely covered in flyposting, making it unsightly, some posters may also be promoting illegal services. The posters appear to be layered and may have been there for several days or weeks. Please arrange for the flyposting to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marylebone Road, Marylebone, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 boxes dumped in Kent Road, 20th June
item.description:
Next to house number 22 Kent Road on right hand side many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Kent Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: My neighbor keeps playing loud music keeping me up of a night on 20/06/24 at 23:00pm. This is causing me distress and restless nights he lives 21 Corsley Way, London E9 5PD. My neighbour has set up a music nightclub in his living room he has a mixing deck professional kit with two big bass speakers. He's up very late doing rap and mixing music. He also leaves his windows and back communal garden door open when loud music is playing. He also organises big social events in his house with an excess of six friends drinking alcohol late. With a red neon lights in living room. Someone Council could ask him kindly to think of his neighbors next door., 20th June
item.description:
My neighbor keeps playing loud music keeping me up of a night. This is causing me distress and restless nights he lives 21 Corsley Way, London E9 5PD. My neighbour has set up a music nightclub in his living room he has a mixing deck professional kit.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Corsley Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously Reported Unactioned Flytip Added To, 20th June
item.description:
The flytipping was reported last week, and is as yet not collected. As feared it's attracting additional dumping with two additional dumping added to the pile. Disgraceful service from RBG!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broad Walk, Well Hall, London

item.title: Large furniture Fly-Tipping at Building Entrance, 20th June
item.description:
These large furniture items have been placed outside of of building entrance. They have been there since Tuesday last week. This is becoming a regular occurrence unfortunately. Clarson House Bolton Crescent Entrance (opposite shops) Camberwell New Road SE5 0AE

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Bolton Crescent, Camberwell, London

item.title: Lime bike blocking entrance to slip road. Could cause a crash,, 20th June
item.description:
It's dark so cannot read number but it's been abandoned earlier this evening at the Penge East end of Lennard Road, Penge, SE207LL. Lying across the entrance to the slip road to garages. Needs to be removed before some car crashes into it trying to get to the garages.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Lawrie Park Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Temporary traffic lights facing the wrong way, 20th June
item.description:
Although construction has finished (happened during the day) the team have left the temporary traffic light in operation (3 way) but the traffic lights are facing the wrong way and there could be a crash.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Laleham Road, Hither Green, London

item.title: Uncollected overflowing bin, 20th June
item.description:
Biffa bin uncollected. Business owner has gone and we are left with this eyesore as residents. Reported multiple times to Biffa and council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Melbourne Avenue, Bowes, London

item.title: People loitering and drinking late at night on the wall of 49 mortimer rd, 20th June
item.description:
Recently theres been a few people loitering late at night in this area drinking. They often engage with passersby causing discomfort and a feeling of general lack of safety.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mortimer Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Graffiti on stone facade of cinema (Hackney Council is Freeholder), 20th June
item.description:
So many people have already reported this problem, and for some reason it keeps being rejected as not the councils responsibility. However, this building is owned by Hackney Council, and designated as a community space.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Light keeps flickering, 20th June
item.description:
Hallway light top floor of Canalside studios is flickering on and off continuously which shines into surrounding flats and is very annoying at night time. It's been happening for over a month.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Orsman Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Outside 52 Hadley Street, 20th June
item.description:
The lamppost outside 52 Hadley street has had its bulb replaced last week and now shines brightly through our bedroom window during the night. Please can you fit a baffle to avoid the light being directed into our window
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Lewis Street, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping (years), 20th June
item.description:
Hi The amount of fly tipping at the bottom of Wernbrook Street is insane. Currently we have a double bed an ENORMOUS bean bag and lots of other rubbish. If the council kindly pick it up, I guarantee a load more will be dumped shortly afterwards. Is there nothing we can do about it? Could you set up a camera, for example? It's been going on for years. We're all sick of it. Best wishes, Peter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wernbrook Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard knocked over again, 20th June
item.description:
Bollard knocked over. This is the second time and it was only installed a couple of months ago. It needs a longer post and buried deeper.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 20th June
item.description:
Been parked badly in the same spot for 6 months and never been moved since. MOT expired 29th December 2024 and has been SORN’ed. This is a public parking spot and thus cannot be SORN’ed. Furthermore previously on multiple occasions the same owner of the vehicle has left abandoned vehicles in the same area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alnwick Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
